intro: Chrysaspis filiformis, commonly known as the slender chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
